If Rg3  36 Kh6 .... 37 h5 gxh5 38 Kxh5 and white has a pair of connected passed pawns.  Perpetual check is avoided by weaving the king down to the 3rd or 4th row.
Material is now even but white wins the race to the queening square

Freeing white's rook and threatening 38 f6  Kf8 39 e7  Ke8 40 f7  Kd7 41 e8=Q

Again perpetual check can be avoided by bringing the white king down to the 4th row 39 ... Rf3 40 Kg5 Rg3  41 Kf4 Rc3 42 f6  Kxf6 43 e7 Rc8 44 e8=Q 

Other ideas 39 ... Rg8 40 f6  Kxf6 41 e7 Kf7 42 e8=Q  Rxe8 43 Rxe8 Kxe8 44 Kg7 a4 White Queens first with check giving the needed move to catch black
